title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 8-1.13 - Enclosures
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 8-1.13 - Enclosures

State Regulations

In factory buildings erected before October 1, 1913; in
mercantile establishments in buildings erected before November 1, 1920. (a) The sides of all hoistways where there
are no landings shall have enclosures extending from the floor not less than 72
inches in height. (See §
8-1.14.)
(b) The landing sides of all hoistways shall
have enclosures extending from the floor to the ceiling. (See §
8-1.14.)

Exceptions: (1)

Existing freight elevator hoistways. Exceptions: (2)

Existing freight elevator hoistways
provided with trap doors. (c) All elevator hoistway enclosures shall be
provided with doors or gates. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
8-1.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
